title: Asteroid 2024 YR4 no longer poses significant impact risk
summary: The latest analysis from the European Space Agency (ESA) Planetary Defence Office has reduced the probability that asteroid 2024 YR4 might impact Earth in 2032 to 0.001%.

title: SpaceX completes investigation into Starship Flight 7 mishap
summary:
Propellant leaks created by an unexpectedly strong harmonic response caused the loss of SpaceX’s Starship vehicle on a test flight last month.
The post SpaceX completes investigation into Starship Flight 7 mishap appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Poland Completes Second Variable-Thrust Rocket Engine Test Campaign
summary:
The Łukasiewicz Research Network’s Institute of Aviation has successfully completed its second hot-fire test campaign for the Throttleable Liquid Propulsion Demonstrator rocket engine. Development of the Throttleable Liquid Propulsion Demonstrator (TLPD) is led by a consortium of Polish companies under ESA’s Future Launchers Preparatory Programme. The engine uses high-test peroxide and ethanol and is capable […]
The post Poland Completes Second Variable-Thrust Rocket Engine Test Campaign appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: NASA associate administrator for exploration to retire
summary:
The head of NASA’s exploration programs is leaving the agency in the latest leadership shakeup since the start of the Trump administration.
The post NASA associate administrator for exploration to retire appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Asteroid 2024 YR4 No Threat to Earth, but Maybe the Moon
summary: As many scientists expected, further observations of asteroid 2024 YR4 have reduced the chances of it colliding with Earth to basically zero. The asteroid made headlines a month ago when […]

title: More Leadership Changes at NASA

title: Space Force to play ‘central role’ in Iron Dome U.S. missile defense initiative
summary:
Given the future system’s heavy reliance on space assets, "I think we have a central role to play," said Gen. Chance Saltzman.

title: Five Facts About NASA’s Moon Bound Technology
summary: NASA is sending revolutionary technologies to the Moon aboard Intuitive Machines’ second lunar delivery as part of the agency’s CLPS (Commercial Lunar Payload Services) initiative and Artemis campaign to establish a long-term presence on the lunar surface.  As part of this CLPS flight to the Moon, NASA’s Space Technology Mission Directorate will test novel technologies to […]

title: Despite looming defense cuts, analysts see long-term upside for space investments
summary:
